h1.b: High Level architecture for the "LightSender Little Cute Monster (LSLCM)"

div.div: - small connecttors which accept simple commands, specific to the service they interact with.
For instance, for DKIM we'd have commands such as "add domain:example.com privKey:aaabbbccc".
For DNS, comands such as "add record domain:example.com type:TXT value:'spf. blabla'"

switch.text: High Level architecture for the "LightSender Little Cute Monster (LSLCM)"...

div.div: A connector is an adaptor that translates high level
A command can be some piece of code, so that we can push small programs that perform actions, instead of hardcoding them in the connector itself.
For instance, a program can be used to load balance load (this replacing the postfix rand_map).
Or it can also be used to route everything from a domain to a specific server.
TODO: what language to use for implement the commands? The best options are Lua (easy) or WebAssembly (high performance)

switch.text: A connector is an adaptor that translates high level...
